summary: The diff implements most of REQ-36: InstallButton.tsx is updated to always be visible (unless already installed), uses usePWAInstall hook for native prompt, and falls back to a new InstallInstructionsModal with browser-specific step-by-step instructions for Chrome, Safari, Edge, and Firefox. The button uses the golden theme. One acceptance criterion has a gap: the button still conditionally returns null when isInstalled is true, but the core requirement about not hiding when the install prompt is unavailable is satisfied.

missing_requirements.requirement: The existing InstallButton.tsx component is updated or replaced so that it no longer conditionally hides itself when the install prompt is unavailable.
missing_requirements.reason: The updated InstallButton.tsx still returns null when isInstalled is true. The AC states the button should be 'always visible in the app header regardless of browser PWA support'. In standalone/installed mode the button is hidden entirely, which may conflict with the always-visible requirement.

hallucinated_features.description: Installation instructions are provided in Portuguese (Brazilian) rather than English
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not specify a language for the manual installation instructions. All step-by-step text in InstallInstructionsModal.tsx is written in Portuguese, which was not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Firefox (Android) browser guide included in the modal
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-36 specifies Chrome, Safari, and Edge as the required browsers for manual install instructions. A Firefox (Android) guide was added beyond what was requested.
